meanings.definition: Capable of being masked or concealed.
meanings.sent1: The spy used a maskable disguise to blend in with the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The treasure was maskable under layers of rocks and leaves.
meanings.sent3: The magician's maskable trick left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: Her true emotions were maskable behind a smile.
meanings.sent5: The chameleon's maskable ability to change colors amazed the children.

meanings.definition: Able to be covered or hidden.
meanings.sent1: The secret entrance was maskable by a large painting on the wall.
meanings.sent2: The cat found a maskable spot under the bed to take a nap.
meanings.sent3: The missing toy was maskable in the toy box all along.
meanings.sent4: The moon was maskable by the passing clouds in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The thief's footsteps were maskable in the freshly fallen snow.

meanings.sent1: The true identity of the masked hero was maskable to the public.
meanings.sent2: The sound of the approaching car was maskable by the loud music.
meanings.sent3: The cat's attempt to catch the laser pointer was maskable entertainment.
meanings.sent4: The artist's emotions were maskable in the abstract painting.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh flowers was maskable by the strong perfume in the room.
